abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, as most project objectives were attained. Key
            lessons learned from the projects are: 1) To facilitate
            implementation, projects should not be too complex or
            involve too many different agencies and activities. 2) A
            full-time project coordinator is needed to implement complex
            projects involving many agencies, donors, and activities. 3)
            For complex projects involving many agencies, regular
            meetings of a ministerial level body demonstrates Government
            commitment to environmental protection and the project. 4)
            Regular monthly meetings chaired by the agency responsible
            for project coordination improves communications and helps
            in quickly identifying problems and finding solutions. 5)
            Project implementation benefits from the use of action
            plans. 6) All preparatory activities should be completed
            prior to signing the legal agreement. 7) Individual project
            components should not be overly designed, but should match
            the technical capabilities of countries. 8) Operations and
            maintenance requirements should be estimated and sources of
            financing identified prior to undertaking investments. 9)
            The participatory and open process of decision-making
            adopted in the project helps prevent corruption within
            government, and strengthens democratic institutions overall.
